comment: I took him over the summer. We had a LOT of homework but that was because the class was only 4 weeks long. I was so nervous for this class but ended with an A. As long as you put in some effort, you will be fine. Lots of the test questions are from the quizzes, which you can look back on. Only tests are lockdown. I'd take him again!

As long as you read the textbook and study his lectures you're gonna get a B or an A. he had two papers both of which were fairly simple and he isn't a tough grader. he had lots of quizzes all easy as long as your reading the chapters and lectures. he uses the questions on review quizzes for his exams so super easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: He can only talk, he cannot teach in a manner that makes sense to students who are very new to SPSS and excel. He doesn't understand that his whole class is lost on what he is saying, and will allow students to continue to be lost while he just continues to lecture. Very knowledgable, but shouldn't be teaching bachelors, should be masters or PHD.

Dr. Jung excelled at explaining complex cognitive psychology concepts clearly and engagingly, making the material approachable. His organized and well-prepared lectures provided a structured learning experience. His enthusiasm and real-world connections were motivating, and his dedication to student success made the course enjoyable and impactful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is awesome if you actually want to learn! This is not an easy course though because he does assign a LOT of stuff. Overall he will help you out and give amazing feedback to know what you do wrong. Most of his tests are straight off of quiz questions so as long as you keep up throughout the course you will do well!

Very nice guy, and he definitely cares about the stuff he's talking about and your success. However, at least for me, it felt after the first week of class he formed opinions about students very quickly. Unfortunately for whatever reason he just didn't seem to like me. I'm not sure what i did but my advice would be try to get on his good side.

I absolutely loved the layout of his course. The only thing I wish he did was include an audio lecture, however the coursework that he does include is plenty to get you an A in the class. If you want to ace the exams, just memorize the answers to all the Review Quiz questions. The small chapter assignments and application essays are super easy.

Dr. J is great! I took this in the summer (4week) the schedule can look scary but it's all helpful! He uses the same quiz questions on the exam. Responds fast to emails and is not a tough grader. Do the work an you should get an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. J is AMAZING! Take his Psyc4455 class! You will not regret it. Make sure you get the textbook because everything is reliant on it. He breaks your grades over the chapters so if you have a bad day, no sweat. 40% of your grade is 3 tests, but if you do everything properly, you won't have any problems getting As. He is generous with extra credit.
Best teacher, hands down! Great communicator and the assignments were all straightforward.

Great guy and easy class. Graded all the assignments the day you turned them in. Clear instructions on how to do the assignments to the point where its step by step what to do. As long as you read the textbook, follow his instructions and turn everything on time, it will be very hard to fail this class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Took cognitive psychology and advanced psychology lab for him. He's more lenient with cognitive psychology than he was with advanced psychology lab. Though with the advanced psych lab, that class wasn't easy to begin with but he made it easy for us to understand and will help us whenever it is needed. He is a nice professor.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr.J is very passionate about Cognitive Psychology and does a great job teaching this course! There are lots of quizzes but they are relatively short and easy as long as you read the textbook and the powerpoint! He always leaves kind messages and wants the best for his students! I hope I get to take him again.

Unlike most other research courses you do your own research that adds off of his previous. It is a bit daunting and time consuming but you can use it as research experience on your grad school applications! The work itself is pretty standard and he offers a lot of help if you ask for it. Dr.J is a professor who genuinely wants to see you succeed!

The professor makes this class a research study. It is based on a previous study in one of his other classes. You are assigned a group and yall think of another variable that could be studied. You have to learn a bunch of new programs and there is a lot of outside work. If you are looking for a glimpse into research then this is the class for you.

This professor really cares about his students. There is a good amount of work, yeah, but it's not hard and it actually helps you learn the material. Any time I messaged him and needed help, he was so respectful and helpful.

He posts long ppts each week with no lectures. You need the textbook to complete the weekly textbook quizzes, the questions are word for word in the book & he puts the page number the answer is on. also a weekly ppt quiz where you just follow along. tests are lockdown with webcam but a lot of the questions are identical to ppt and book quizzes

Prof J is amazing! This is my second time taking him and his teaching style is the same. He is very empathetic and will help you if you ask. The material is pretty straightforward, a lot of long quizzes but they're simple. There is an assignment each week and 3 essays. The exams are pretty simple but can be tricky. I suggest him for any class!

this professor is a truly kind man. he is a fair grader, but understanding, and he makes the tests easier on us by having us do the powerpoint quizzes and chapter quizzes every week. those are a great grade booster. in general, i'd highly recommend him; he really truly cares about students learning a lot.

Taking Statistical Applications was tough with others. But when actually taught and showed how to do something it is definitely easier. No tests but 3 big Analysis Reports that is practiced before they are do. Pays attention to small detail but Great Professor!

He's honestly a great professor, but it's expected that this higher level course requires more reading and attention from you. Granted all his quizzes were based on the textbook and videos he gives you, so the answers are there. You just have to put the effort into reading them. Overall, great professor but a lot of work!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Jung is one of my favorite professors at KSU!! I have taken him for SEVERAL psych courses, including Statistical Applications (one of the hardest courses for psych majors, take him for that too!!). Basically, all tests and quizzes come straight from his powerpoints and lectures. He is also super understanding! 10/10 take him!

Professor Hyung is awesome! I was worried to take his class at first but he makes it so easy. I work full time and I still look forward to getting off and doing his assignments! As long as you have the book you will pass. He also gives study guides for test and really great feedback. He definitely wants you to pass and enjoy learning while at it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor J is just the best. I took him for an online class and the layout was very well structured. There are many things to do each week (Pre-quizes, powerpoint quizes, powerpoint tasks, & review quizes), however, if you have the text it is extremely easy! The topic isn't easy, however Prof J makes it seem like it is. 10/10 would recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor J is great! He knows that stat can be hard so he's really great at explaining. He's not the best at technology so bring a laptop as backup. Weekly quizzes from the textbook he provides, but they're simple. 6 assignments, but he explains them using YouTube. 3 exams but they're made up of the assignments. Highly recommend his class.

Professor Jung set up his class nicely. Every week we had to take 2 "preview" quizzes on the book, a powerpoint quiz over his lecture, a review quiz, and a task that was based from the powerpoint lecture. It was pretty easy. There were 3 tests and 2 other small essay assignments. As long as you do the work, you should be fine.

Dr. J is great!! He really cares about his students and is willing to help anyone if they are unclear. He really cares and is interested in the subject and wants to make sure you are too even if it isn't your favorite! He does have an accent if that may bother you but he is super clear on everything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Would definitely take again! I took this class online over summer in a 4-week session and it was not hard at all. There are a lot of quizzes but you get to use your book and powerpoint and they come word for word from there. 3 tests and 2 essays. Essays are graded easy and as long as you do the study guides for the test, you will make a 100.

The material and grading were reasonable, but he took a disliking to me, even though I had 100% on every homework and quiz, and he made the class so unpleasant for me that I dropped it after the first Midterm.

Attendance was not taken per class but if you want a good grade you should go. (He includes class examples in weekly quizzes- multiple choice). Tests were all short answer (no multiple choice) but he gave you multiple questions to choose from & lenient grader. Down to earth, funny, & genuine! I'd take him again for sure!

Dr. J is great! Good handful of online quizzes but they don't take more than a few minutes and in class quizzes are open note. Exams are like the study guides and as long as you take notes and read over them you'll be good! Super nice and willing to give out extra credit. You're gonna wanna take him!

If youre trying to have an easy stress free experimental class take him. 3 huge writing assignments that are kind of annoying but easy. Tests? Exact same layout as the study guide and he allows a cheat sheet on every exam. His tests are literally just calculations which are easy, u dont have to study long vocabulary and terms for his class!

Dr. J is awesome. He's so thorough and provides you with step by step processes to help you succeed. I learned so much about SPSS this semester. He is a good grader too, offers extra credit. He does have an accent which some people said was difficult but I had no problem understanding him. Experimental is a tough class but he makes it easy TAKE HIM
best psych teacher ever  .. if you want to learn and pass take Dr.J

Dr. J was amazing! He is such a sweet professor and cares about his students. He is very helpful and willing to go over anything that does not make sense. The contents of the course are hard itself, but he really explains it in the best way possible. I would definitely recommend him!

Dr. J is a very nice person and makes an effort to teach, but is not a very good teacher. I made an A, but that was due to another student in the class giving out help outside of class. If you really want to learn, take someone else. If you need a GPA booster, he is your guy. Super lenient grader. 2/3 of the class is statistics & lots of SPSS work.

Dr. J is a great professor. His lectures are long and sometimes overwhelming, but he will give you every opportunity to succeed! His tests are long, but he gives you study guides and has review sessions. Also, 2 of the 3 tests are open-book, open-note. If you show up to class, do the assignments, and read the textbook for the quizzes - you'll get A

I would definitely take him again. He spends a lot of time clarifying the material and making sure the class understands. His second exam was far too long, but I'm sure he'll take that into account and change it. He is very considerate, learns most student names, and he is actually pretty funny. Go to class or you won't survive.

He is a super sweet professor who really cares about his students. He wants people to be interactive with him and my class just wouldn't do it. His Psyc1101 is an easy A  however if you actually go to class and listen you will learn alot. He also has an accent, but if you pay attention it wont get in the way of learning.

Professor Jay was such a great teacher. He is so concerned for his students and truly wants you to succeed. He only had 1 test in my class which was so easy because he actually taught me during class. If you do the assignments and actually study for a second for the test you will make a 100 in this class. I highly recommend taking him if you can!

Dr. Jay is a very considerate guy who genuinely cares about his job and his students. Lectures can sometimes seem a bit aimless, but he is a fairly easy grader who gives good feedback on assignments. Ask for help and you'll get it. I was very worried about this class as I am not very good at math, but I received a high A and did learn a lot. TAKE.
Terrible Teacher! Do not take him. Disorganized. Takes "forever" to grade assignments.

I took this professor for Engineering Psych. I have been in a group presentation for the entire semester. If you have free time to meet once a week with a group, then go for this class. He is not clear on his instructions and does not know what he wants. There are no tests, which are great, but you have to deal with a group project for like ever.

Honestly a great professor, genuinely cares. He made research methods and statistics manageable and made sense. Offers extra credit, I would HIGHLY recommend taking him for psych2300. He can be a little confusing as to how you will be assessed/ what he is looking for but will clarify if asked and is a VERY generous grader. Learned a lot and made A.

This is honestly the best teacher at KSU. Please take him if you have ANY opportunity! I have had him for the past two semesters and I adore him. He is helpful, calm mannered, funny and very educated on the subjects he teaches. He genuinely cares about each and every one of his students. Ask for help the SECOND you need it and you'll get an A!
